name: Baked Caprese Chicken
description: Amazingly crisp-tender chicken baked with melted mozzarella and topped with juicy tomatoes, fresh basil and balsamic reduction!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
8 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese (cut into 8 slices)

recipeInstructions.text: To make the balsamic reduction, add balsamic vinegar and brown sugar to a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a slight boil and reduce by half, about 6-8 minutes; set aside and let cool.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the balsamic reduction, add balsamic vinegar and brown sugar to a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a slight boil and reduce by half, about 6-8 minutes; set aside and let cool.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine olive oil, basil and oregano; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Using your fingers or a brush, work the mixture onto both sides of the chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine olive oil, basil and oregano; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Using your fingers or a brush, work the mixture onto both sides of the chicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken, skin-side down, and sear both sides until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side; drain excess fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt butter in a large oven-proof skillet over medium high heat. Add chicken, skin-side down, and sear both sides until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side; drain excess fat.

recipeInstructions.text: Place into oven and roast until the chicken is completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 25-30 minutes. Top each chicken with mozzarella cheese. Then broil for 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese has melted completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Place into oven and roast until the chicken is completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 25-30 minutes. Top each chicken with mozzarella cheese. Then broil for 2-3 minutes, or until the cheese has melted completely.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, topped with tomatoes, drizzled with balsamic reduction and garnished with basil, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, topped with tomatoes, drizzled with balsamic reduction and garnished with basil, if desired.

review.reviewBody: Great recipe!  My husband and I really enjoyed the flavors of fresh basil and the balsamic glaze.  I had skinless & boneless chicken thighs so I just adjusted the cooking time.
Amazing, wonderful flavors, tender, juicy. I let the thighs sit with the rub for a couple hours before frying, which certainly can't hurt.
